attribution: Adapted with permission from UCLES, Higher School Certificate Physics, June1938, Paper2.
title: A Coiled Rope

children.value:
A coil of rope of length 
$\valuedef{l}{10}{m}$
 and of mass 
$\valuedef{m}{1}{kg}$
 is lying on a horizontal floor. A man takes hold of one end and walks off at a speed 
$\valuedef{v}{5}{m\,  s\sup {-1}}$
, the rope uncoiling as he goes.
Neglecting friction, calculate the force he exerts on the rope.
The whole rope is now in motion.
Calculate the work done by the man.

answer.value: The kinetic energy obtained is half the total work done by the man. The rest of the work done has been dissipated as heat.
